Description: Papyrus; Hieratic text recto: Teaching of Amenemope; verso: Calendar of Lucky and Unlucky Days.
Curator's comments: Published: Vincent Laisney, l'Enseignement d'Amenemope; Studia Pohl 16; Rome, Pontifical Bible Institute.

The teaching of Amenemope (P BM EA 10474) is translated in M. Lichtheim, Ancient Egyptian literature: a book of readings, 3 vols. (University of California Press, 1973-1980), Volume II, pp. 146-163. There is unfortunately no fully integrated publication of this papyrus. Photographs and a somewhat unreliable transcription into hieroglyphs can be found in Budge, Hieratic Papyri in the British Museum, second series (London 1923); the recent standard treatment contains a transliteration, but no transcription of the hieratic into a hieroglyphic hand, although there are notes on the readings of various words: I. Grumach, Untersuchungen zur Lebenslehre des Amenope. Münchner ägyptologische Studien (Munich and Berlin: Deutscher Kunstverlag) 23, 1972. New study to be published by Vincent Laisney (Pontifical Bible Institute). Verso text published by Herbin BIFAO 86 (1986), 187-98.
Tarasenko, Mykola. 2016. Studies on the vignettes from chapter 17 of the Book of the Dead. I, The image of mś.w Bdšt in ancient Egyptian mythology (Archaeopress Egyptology 16), Oxford, p. 45, 106.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (111307) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/111307)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed
